sys_script_include.description:
Supports calling a function exactly once for each new object encountered. Requires that key equality is the same as object equality.
If you use exists() you must finish using it before calling add() the first time.
If you will call removeRemaining: 1. You must not modify any object you passed to exists() - your object is not copied. 2. You must call add() for every object you want to keep. 3. You must finish adding before calling removeRemaining.
Member functions:
- exists(obj, key): Registers a pre-existing object.
- add(obj, key, objFn): Invoke onceFn the first time this object's key is seen. - objFn(obj): Called the first time this object is encountered, based on the key.
- removeRemaining(removeFn) - removeFn(obj): Called for every existing object that was not also passed to add().
sys_script_include.name: Once
